name:G‚Äçu‚Äçe‚Äçs‚Äçt‚Äç ‚ÄçU‚Äçs‚Äçe‚Äçr

info:25 Reviews
rating:4.7
posted:Posted April 5, 2024
msg:Geographical location: Excellent, just off Exit C of Shouyi Road, and the surrounding bus stations are also very convenient!

Facilities: The lobby is grand, the room is large, even with an extra bed it is not crowded, our room overlooks the Yellow Crane Tower, and the shower water is great! There is water and fruit at the elevator entrance on each floor, which can be taken on demand, which is very user-friendly! In addition, the bed covers, bedding and towels are all new, and the pillows are comfortable!

Service: Everything is very good, except for the air conditioner. Wuhan suddenly became so hot in the first few days that I had to wear short sleeves. The hotel air conditioner maintenance was not completed in time. The hotel sent a fan, but it was still a bit hot. Fortunately, it cooled down on the last day üòÇ There are also free afternoon tea and check-in fruit.

Satisfied, recommended!

msg:The hotel is unexpectedly good, with very convenient transportation. Line 4 departs from Wuhan Station, and Shouyi Road is right outside the subway station. Afternoon tea is from 2 o'clock to 10 o'clock in the evening. After going out for a while, I don't want to eat at night. I can drink some porridge and eat some noodles. It's very good! 
I will choose this place next time I come to Wuhan

name:G‚Äçu‚Äçe‚Äçs‚Äçt‚Äç ‚ÄçU‚Äçs‚Äçe‚Äçr
info:Business Twin Room
info:Stayed in March 2024
info:Family
info:4 Reviews
rating:4.5
posted:Posted April 2, 2024
msg:I came to Wuhan for a trip and chose this hotel. The transportation is very convenient. It is right next to the subway. I booked a business room and checked in at 8pm. I asked the front desk for alcohol spray and they said it would be delivered to the room, but it was not delivered until I checked out. Then I took the initiative to ask if there was afternoon tea. The front desk said that it was only available in the executive room, but because I stayed for three days, it was given to me. Would it be gone if I didn't ask? Then I saw people's comments that the deluxe room was given to people who stayed for one day. There was no hand-drawn map, and there was no WeChat butler service. I didn't feel that the service was very enthusiastic. The environment was still okay. The room could see a little bit of the Yellow Crane Tower. The breakfast variety was not rich but the taste was good. The waiter's attitude was also good. The drinks and milk in the mini bar in the room were free. There were cherry blossom mung bean cake snacks in the evening. The afternoon tea had porridge, desserts, fruit yogurt, hot dry noodles, etc., which could be eaten as dinner. The comments about check-out said that there were souvenirs, but they were gone when I got here. It might be random! Overall it's ok, more than 600 a night is still cost-effective! One last thing I want to complain about is that the clothesline in the bathroom is installed too high. I wanted to stand on it with a chair but unfortunately the chair couldn't fit in. In the end I had to stand on the trash can upside down to reach it. I've stayed in many hotels but this is the first time I've seen it installed so high.

Wuhan, Wuchang, I started from here, and although I am gray-haired, I am still young when I return!

When I called It's already 6:58, even if it's only two minutes away, this is the first time I've encountered such a weird thing after staying in so many hotels. When I asked for directions at the front desk, I didn't know anything about it. The hotel's breakfast was also extremely confusing; and there were corridors. The lights in the room were not turned on, and it was dark and uncomfortable to look at; the equipment in the room was also very old, but the business floor room I stayed in was quite spacious, and I could overlook the Yellow Crane Tower, which was pretty good; Also, the afternoon tea is open until 9:00 pm, which is quite good; the hotel is not far from the "Xinhai Revolution Memorial Hall", about 15-20 minutes' walk.
